nodes.documentation:
Constructor for the token to set readable details and mint all tokens
to the specified owner.

Function that can only be called by an owner that updates the address
with the ERC1404 Transfer Restrictions defined
nodes.name: updateTransferRestrictions

nodes.documentation: The address with the Transfer Restrictions contract
nodes.name: getRestrictionsAddress

nodes.documentation:
This function detects whether a transfer should be restricted and not allowed.
If the function returns SUCCESS_CODE (0) then it should be allowed.
nodes.name: detectTransferRestriction

nodes.documentation:
This function allows a wallet or other client to get a human readable string to show
a user if a transfer was restricted.  It should return enough information for the user
to know why it failed.
nodes.name: messageForTransferRestriction

nodes.documentation: Evaluates whether a transfer should be allowed or not.
nodes.name: notRestricted

nodes.documentation: Overrides the parent class token transfer function to enforce restrictions.
nodes.name: transfer

nodes.documentation: Overrides the parent class token transferFrom function to enforce restrictions.
nodes.name: transferFrom

nodes.documentation:
Constructor for the token to set readable details and mint all tokens
to the specified owner.

Function that can only be called by an owner that updates the address
with the ERC1404 Transfer Restrictions defined
nodes.name: updateTransferRestrictions

nodes.documentation: The address with the Transfer Restrictions contract
nodes.name: getRestrictionsAddress

nodes.documentation:
This function detects whether a transfer should be restricted and not allowed.
If the function returns SUCCESS_CODE (0) then it should be allowed.
nodes.name: detectTransferRestriction

nodes.documentation:
This function allows a wallet or other client to get a human readable string to show
a user if a transfer was restricted.  It should return enough information for the user
to know why it failed.
nodes.name: messageForTransferRestriction

nodes.documentation: Evaluates whether a transfer should be allowed or not.
nodes.name: notRestricted

nodes.documentation: Overrides the parent class token transfer function to enforce restrictions.
nodes.name: transfer

nodes.documentation: Overrides the parent class token transferFrom function to enforce restrictions.
nodes.name: transferFrom

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

params._address: the address to retrieve the data from

checkLockup(address).return: array of 2 uint256, release time (in seconds since the epoch) and amount (in INX)

checkTimelock(address,uint256,uint256).details: return true if the given account has enough unlocked tokens to send the requested amount

params._address: the address to retrieve the data from
params.balance: the token balance of the sending account

checkWhitelists(address,address).details: Determine if sender and receiver are whitelisted, return true if both accounts are whitelisted

decimals().details: Returns the number of decimals used to get its user representation. For example, if `decimals` equals `2`, a balance of `505` tokens should be displayed to a user as `5,05` (`505 / 10 ** 2`).     * Tokens usually opt for a value of 18, imitating the relationship between Ether and Wei.     * NOTE: This information is only used for _display_ purposes: it in no way affects any of the arithmetic of the contract, including {IERC20-balanceOf} and {IERC20-transfer}.

decreaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically decreases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address. - `spender` must have allowance for the caller of at least `subtractedValue`.

getWhitelistData(address).details: Get the data of and address in the whitelist

params._address: the address to retrieve the data from

getWhitelistStatus(address).details: Get the status of the whitelist

increaseAllowance(address,uint256).details: Atomically increases the allowance granted to `spender` by the caller.     * This is an alternative to {approve} that can be used as a mitigation for problems described in {IERC20-approve}.     * Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance.     * Requirements:     * - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

lock(address,uint256,uint256).details: lock address and amount and lock it, set the release time

params.releaseTime: of the locked amount (in seconds since the epoch)

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

pause().details: called by pauser role to pause, triggers stopped state

paused().return: true if the contract is paused, false otherwise.

params._address: the address to retrieve the data from

params.data: a string with data about the whitelisted address
params.status: the whitelisting status (true for yes, false for no)

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

unpause().details: called by pauer role to unpause, returns to normal state

methods.constructor: Constructor for the token to set readable details and mint all tokens to the specified owner.

detectTransferRestriction(address,addres.notice: This function detects whether a transfer should be restricted and not allowed. If the function returns SUCCESS_CODE (0) then it should be allowed.

getRestrictionsAddress().notice: The address with the Transfer Restrictions contract

messageForTransferRestriction(uint8).notice: This function allows a wallet or other client to get a human readable string to show a user if a transfer was restricted.  It should return enough information for the user to know why it failed.

transfer(address,uint256).notice: Overrides the parent class token transfer function to enforce restrictions.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).notice: Overrides the parent class token transferFrom function to enforce restrictions.

updateTransferRestrictions(address).notice: Function that can only be called by an owner that updates the address with the ERC1404 Transfer Restrictions defined
